CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mary Williams, housewife, 852 Whiteside Road, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 1, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that 18-year-olds should be given the privilege of voting?" answer reads: "They are grown up enough to vote. At 18, they are on their own, and old enough to know just what they are doing."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Williams wearing light colored pleated blouse, light colored button earrings, and sunglasses, standing in front of Fifth Avenue across from Thrift Drugs and Kappels, Downtown
